I don’t think they are looking at the results to see whether or not you lied when answering one of their questions since there’s such a broad margin of error to be considered a reasonable approach. I think what they are interpreting from the results is how you are physically/emotionally responding to the inherent stress of the situation. They can’t determine if you were lying; they know that, but they can see that your heart rate was going crazy when asked basic questions and were freaking the fuck out for a majority of the interview. And if you can’t handle that, you probably aren’t a good fit for the job since if hired, you will be expected to remain calm and be capable of functioning with a high degree of mental clarity and composure in way more high stress/high stakes situations than a polygraph interview.
